alert.note: Alert for Clay (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued July 28 at 8:45AM EDT until July 29 at 12:40AM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Jackson KY has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Kentucky... South Fork Kentucky River at Oneida affecting Clay County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... ...REPLACES RIVER FLOOD ADVISORY... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...South Fork Kentucky River at Oneida. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 34.0 feet, Moderate flooding occurs. Several feet of water in multiple Oneida Baptist Institute buildings and the town of Oneida is cut off. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 AM EDT Thursday the stage was 27.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this morning to a crest of 33.5 feet this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage this evening. - Flood stage is 29.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 33.9 feet on 02/28/1962. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. The next statement will be issued 2 pm EDT.
